00040 #ifndef _physicsmanager_h
00041 #define _physicsmanager_h
00042 
00043 //forward Declarations so that we do not need #include "btBulletDynamicsCommon.h"
00044 class btAxisSweep3;
00045 class btDefaultCollisionConfiguration;
00046 class btCollisionDispatcher;
00047 class btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver;
00048 class btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld;
00049 class btDynamicsWorld;
00050 class btCollisionShape;
00051 
00052 #include <map>
00053 
00054 #include "managerbase.h"
00055 #include "constraint.h"
00056 
00057 namespace phys
00058 {
00059     // internal forward declarations
00060     class World;
00061     class ActorBase;
00062     namespace debug {
00063         class InternalDebugDrawer;
00064     }
00065     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066     /// @class PhysicsManager
00067     /// @headerfile physicsmanager.h
00068     /// @brief This is simply a place for storing all the Physics Related functions
00069     /// @details This is a plage for storing items related to Debug physics
00070     /// drawing, Adding constraints, screwing with gravity and doing other physics
00071     /// Related features.
00072     class PhysicsManager : ManagerBase
00073     {
00074         private:
00075             friend class World;
00076             //Some Data Items
00077             Vector3 GeographyLowerBounds;
00078             Vector3 GeographyUpperBounds;
00079             unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies;
00080             //Real PhysicsStepsize; // use this->GameWorld->TargetFrameLength instead
00081             unsigned short int CollisionAge;
00082             Real Impulse;
00083             std::map< String, btCollisionShape* > PhysicsShapes;
00084 
00085             // Some Items bullet requires
00086             btAxisSweep3* BulletBroadphase;
00087             btDefaultCollisionConfiguration* BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00088             btCollisionDispatcher* BulletDispatcher;
00089             btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver* BulletSolver;
00090             btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* BulletDynamicsWorld;
00091             debug::InternalDebugDrawer* BulletDrawer;
00092 
00093             /// @brief This takes care of all the real work in contructing this
00094             /// @details This method is called by all the constructors to insure consistent behavior.
00095             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World that this manager will work with
00096             /// @param GeographyLowerBounds_ This Vector3 will loosely represent the lower right conrer of the world
00097             /// @param GeographyUpperbounds_ This Vector3 will loosely represent the upper left conrer of the world
00098             /// @param MaxPhysicsProxies_ This approximates the maximum amount of items allowed in the physics world
00099             void Construct(World* GameWorld_, const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00100         public:
00101 
00102             /// @brief Simple Constructor
00103             /// @details This constructor will assign some sane default values and will create a physics
00104             /// world that can be used immediately
00105             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the game world this PhysicsManager will work with
00106             PhysicsManager(World* GameWorld_);
00107 
00108             /// @brief Simple Constructor
00109             /// @details This constructor will assign some sane default values and will create a physics
00110             /// world that can be used immediately
00111             /// @param GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World that this manager will work with
00112             /// @param GeographyLowerBounds_ This Vector3 will loosely represent the lower right conrer of the world
00113             /// @param GeographyUpperbounds_ This Vector3 will loosely represent the upper left conrer of the world
00114             /// @param MaxPhysicsProxies_ This approximates the maximum amount of items allowed in the physics world
00115             PhysicsManager(World* GameWorld_, const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_, const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_, const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00116 
00117             /// @brief This configures the Physics Manager to work with the Graphic settings
00118             /// @details This configures the Physics manager to work with the existing graphics settings. This must
00119             /// be called before the physics manager is used, but after the graphics have been initialized
00120             virtual void Initialize();
00121 
00122             /// @brief Empty MainLoopItems
00123             /// @details This class implements this for the sake of entension and compatibility this function does nothing
00124             virtual void DoMainLoopItems();
00125 
00126             /// @brief Deconstructor
00127             /// @details This deletes all those crazy pointers that Bullet, the physics subsystem need.
00128             ~PhysicsManager();
00129 
00130             /// @brief Sets the gravity.
00131             /// @details Sets the strength and direction of gravity within the world.
00132             /// @param pgrav Vector3 representing the strength and direction of gravity.
00133             void SetGravity(Vector3 pgrav);
00134 
00135             /// @brief Enables and Disables Physics Debug Drawing
00136             /// @details Enables and Disables Physics Debug Drawing using default wireframes. This will force renderings that match the physics
00137             /// subsytem pixel for pixel.
00138             /// @param ToBeEnabled 1 to turn it on, 0 to turn it off. There may be other options in the future, to enable fine tuned control
00139             void SetDebugPhysicsRendering(int ToBeEnabled);
00140 
00141             /// @brief Is Physics Debug Drawing currently enabled?
00142             /// @details lets you check if Physics Debug Drawing is enabled or not.
00143             /// @return 1 for it is on, and 0 for it is not. The may be other options later for selectively cnacking certain features
00144             int GetDebugPhysicsRendering();
00145 
00146             /// @brief How many Wireframes do you want drawn from previous events
00147             /// @details Each frame of the action gets its own wire frame, and how many of those back did you want to see? To see a minimal amount
00148             /// set this to 2, as the first wireframe is commonly entirely inside the  the rendered 3d mesh. You can use World::GetTargetFrameTime()
00149             /// In conjunction with this to specify an amout of seconds worth of wireframes.
00150             /// @param WireFrameCount_ This is a whole number that is the amount of wire frames you wan to see. Don't forget to be mindful of the framerate,
00151             /// Any amount more than just a few seconds worth can be cumbersome.
00152             void SetDebugPhysicsWireCount(Whole WireFrameCount_);
00153 
00154             /// @brief This gets how many WireFrames are being drawn.
00155             /// @details This will tell you how many frames worth of previous in game events are being drawn.
00156             /// @return This returns either 2 or the last amount passed into World::SetDebugPhysicsWireCount .
00157             Whole GetDebugPhysicsWireCount();
00158 
00159             /// @brief This does all the work reuired for the main loop to process physics
00160             /// @details
00161             /// @param TimeElapsed This is a real that represents the amount of time we need to simulate
00162             void DoMainLoopItems(const Real &TimeElapsed);
00163 
00164             /// @brief Adds a constraint to the world.
00165             /// @details Adds the constraint to the world so that it can/will take effect.
00166             /// @param Constraint The constraint to be added.
00167             void AddConstraint(TypedConstraint* Constraint);
00168 
00169             /// @brief Removes a constraint from the world.
00170             /// @details Removes a constraint from the world so that it will have no effect.
00171             /// @param Constraint The constraint to be removed.
00172             void RemoveConstraint(TypedConstraint* Constraint);
00173 
00174             /// @brief Stores an already generated physics shape.
00175             /// @details This function will take an actors physics shape and store it for re-use in other actors, in case a shape is able to be re-used by other actors.
00176             /// @param Actor The actor from which to store the shape.
00177             /// @param ShapeName The name you wish to assign to the shape being stored.
00178             void StorePhysicsShape(ActorBase* Actor, String &ShapeName);
00179 
00180             /// @brief Applies a previously stored shape.
00181             /// @details This function will take a stored shape and apply it to the actor provided.
00182             /// @param Actor The actor to which you want to apply the shape.
00183             /// @param ShapeName The name of the shape you wish to have applied to the actor.
00184             void ApplyPhysicsShape(ActorBase* Actor, String &ShapeName);
00185 
00186             /// @brief Sets the Collision Parameters.
00187             /// @details Sets the Collision Age and Force Filters used in filtering out collision contacts used to make events.  The lower these numbers, the more events will be generated.  @n
00188             /// These numbers both default to 1.
00189             /// @param Age The number of physics ticks the collision has to have existed to be used.  Usually you want 1 or 2.  Default: 1
00190             /// @param Force The amount of force applied in the collision to filter by.  This amount can vary more then the other param based on what you need.  Default: 1.0
00191             void SetCollisionParams(const unsigned short int Age, Real Force);
00192 
00193             /// @brief Gets the Collision Age limit.
00194             /// @details Gets the CollisionAge used in filtering out collision contacts used to make events.
00195             /// @return This function will return the number of physics ticks the collision has to have existed to be used.
00196             unsigned short int GetCollisionAge();
00197 
00198             /// @brief Gets the Collision Impulse limit.
00199             /// @details Gets the Collision Impulse used in filtering out collision contacts used to make events.
00200             /// @return This function will return the lower limit of the allowed force of the collision to generate an event.
00201             Real GetImpulse();
00202 
00203             /// @internal
00204             /// @brief This returns a pointer to the bullet physics world. This is for internal use only
00205             btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* GetPhysicsWorldPointer();
00206 
00207         //Inherited from ManagerBase
00208             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00209             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::PhysicsManager
00210             virtual ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00211     };
00212 }
00213 
00214 #endif
